processed_hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Mirdas al-Thaqafi: Some camels of my brother escaped, so he pursued them and they pelted him with stones. I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and he executed retaliation upon them.

processed_hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ya'la ibn Murrah al-Thaqafi from his father: We were with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ during a journey. I saw three amazing things from him: We descended in a land with many trees called al-Ashshaa'. He said: Go to those two trees and tell them: The Prophet ﷺ commands you to come together. I went to them and told them, and they came together. The Prophet ﷺ stood and fulfilled his need. Then he said: Tell them to separate, and they separated. Then a woman came with a child of hers. She said: O Prophet of Allah, this boy has epilepsy three times a month. He said: Bring him near. I brought him near, and he spat in his mouth and said: Go out, O enemy of Allah, I am the Messenger of Allah. Then he said to her: When you return, inform me what he does. When the Prophet ﷺ returned, she met him with two rams, butter (samn), and dried yogurt (aqit). The Prophet ﷺ said to me: Take one of the two rams. She said: O Messenger of Allah, we have not seen that from him. Then a camel came with tears flowing from its eyes. He said: Whose camel is this? They said: It belongs to the family of so-and-so. He sent to them and they came to him. He said: What is wrong with this camel that complains about you? They said: It was a well-watering camel for us and it grew old, so we wanted to slaughter it. The Prophet ﷺ said: Leave it with the camels, so they left it.

processed_hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Jahdhimah, wife of Bashir: We arrived at the Messenger of Allah ﷺ at the time of Dhuhr prayer. He went out to prayer with henna stain on his head. We prayed. Then he turned away, and Bashir ibn al-Khassasiyah stood to him and complained of his estrangement and separation from his people. The Prophet ﷺ said to him: Do you not thank Allah the Most High Who took your hearing and sight away from Rabi'ah?

Mu'awiyah (may Allah be pleased with him) wrote back to him: If you fear anything, place the banner (standard) with Rabi'ah, for I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: "Verily, the polytheists will not prevail as long as the banner is with Rabi'ah."
